editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A00001 of text S115782 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 1). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 147 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 35 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. Searching, reading, printing, or downloading EEBO-TCP texts is reserved for the authorized users of these project partner institutions. Permission must be granted for subsequent distribution, in print or electronically, of this EEBO-TCP Phase II text, in whole or in part.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption on leaf B1r; imprint from STC.
Continues the text of STC 23867.5: Tell-trothes new-yeares gift beeing Robin Good-fellowes newes.
Running title reads: The passionate morrice.
Reproduction of the original in the Peterborough Cathedral. Library.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: [The passoinate [sic] morrice]

ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 51.6 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the D category of texts with between 35 and 100 defects per 10,000 words.
